page.title: 15COMMUTER BELT - HORTON KIRBY
page.content: The commuter belt surrounding London has grown systematically over the past 25 years. Both employment and housing patterns have changed with resulting effects on family life. London, with its job opportunities but relatively expensive housing, has required a steady level of employment. Consequently, Horton Kirby, South Darenth and other similar communities have become part of the commuting belt. A reasonable train service and direct road routes to employment centres have contributed to this change. The main objective when comm- uting to work in London is to reduce travelling time and costs to the minimum. The railway is often hampered by bad weather and labour disputes, and road travel is delayed by traffic congestion. The uncertainty of travel time is the commuters' nightmare.
